review.reviewBody: Let me start by saying that I love this bag.  Have used it 30+ nights.   Love the synthetic fill and the construction is solid.  Fit is good.  It’s clearly an economy priced bag and so the features reflect that.  The cinches for the face opening are a little clunky and the neck baffle is basic.  But all in all, it’s a really comfy bag.  The issue that costs it a star in my review is that it is absolutely and completely NOT a -20 bag.  I accept the reality of what it is capable of and don’t take this one when the temps go below high single digits Fahrenheit.  My assessment is that it’s awesome in the 20’s, passable in the high teens but totally not up to the task in the single digits or lower.  Again, I love this bag.  I just wish mountain hardware would get accurate with its rating or else actually add the fill required to make this thing an actual -20 degree bag.
review.name: Favorite bag for most conditions

review.reviewBody: Love this sleeping bag! the best value for money. It's warm and durable. I used it in minus 15 C.
review.name: Great quality

review.reviewBody: NOT A -20 BAG. Left my feet and shoulders very cold on a night that didn’t get below 20F.
review.name: Chilly feet

name: Lamina -20F Sleeping Bag

hasVariant.name: Novo Force Trainer
hasVariant.description: Buy the Elite Novo Force Trainer online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Bought this trainer to ride indoors when the weather doesn't look so good outside. It does what its intended purpose with no fuss. It came with all the needed, like the skewer and other parts. 

However, the unit itself tends to be unstable and it rocks a bit when riding out the saddle, hoped that the legs were wider at the front, but I am not a "wattmonster". I just bought this trainer so that I can keep my legs spinning. 

The unit is noticeably noisy, which I expected given that it's a mag trainer. The faster your wheel spins on the trainer, the louder it gets, so keep that in mind.

In my opinion, this is a great trainer if you are looking for a fuss-free, simple and easy to use trainer that is kind to your wallet. It does not have all the smart and fancy features as the other more expensive trainers, but it is a great "bang for the buck" magnetic trainer.
review.name: It is what it is

name: Novo Force Trainer

description: Buy the Contour Skins Hybrid Pure 135 Climbing Skins online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Hybrid Pure 135 Climbing Skins
hasVariant.description: Buy the Contour Skins Hybrid Pure 135 Climbing Skins online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
For what it's worth, this review is the result of skiing with these skins for the past 3 years.

Grip is excellent, I would say its almost as good if not as good as any other skins I've used, nylon, mohair or blended. In my opinion there is no tradeoff with grip.

Glide is as good as you could hope for. I do a lot of low angle skinning (for those in the Wasatch, up Millcreek road with the dog for example) and these glide almost like a classic nordic ski. When skiing with others I frequently notice that my step cadence is far slower than theirs when going the same speed. The glide is just really excellent. 

No complaints with the glue whatsoever. After 3 years it still seems quite sticky, but not to the point that you have to hit the gym for a few months in the fall to build up the strength to rip them apart. Equally as important, I have no issues getting these to stick for multiple laps when packed away in my jacket pockets to warm them back up. It doesn't get very cold here very often, but a few weeks ago I went for a few uphill laps at PCMR and temps were about 0 Fahrenheit, skins had no issue sticking to the ski base.

Packability is also quite good. The backing material is definitely not as thin as others out there, but I have these cut to width on a 108mm width ski in the longest length sold, and they still easily pack into my softshell chest pockets.
review.name: Extremely Nice Climbing Skins

name: Hybrid Pure 135 Climbing Skins

description: Buy the PEARL iZUMi ELITE Gel Full-Finger Glove - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: ELITE Gel Full-Finger Glove - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the PEARL iZUMi ELITE Gel Full-Finger Glove - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I?ve used PI gloves more than other brands for decades. Because of that, I expected to need XL to fit my fairly long fingers. The size chart only uses hand width and going by that I?d need M. I went with XL and glad I did as my fingers reach the ends. Also at my wrist (I?m thin) the closures only go about halfway. There?s no way I?d fit in M. 

I haven?t had them out on the bike yet but they are comfortable and the touch screen feature works. They are very similar in the functional parts as the PI ones they will replace. 

The disappointment is the design and quality is not up to old PI standards. These are far less well made than my last pair of the same basic thing (probably 5 yrs old). The wrist closures are thin and flimsy with Velcro sewn loosely to the fabric. I can tell that?s going to fail after not long. I?ll get the intended use out of these but I?m sure I?ll be glove shopping again pretty soon. Not good PI, you used to make high quality products that lasted a long time and were worth a bit extra cash. These aren?t.
review.name: Not up to old PI standard

name: ELITE Gel Full-Finger Glove - Men's

review.reviewBody:
Perfect! I’m 5’8 around 165 pounds, athletic build with curvy thighs. I purchased a size medium. These hit just past the top of my foot, about about 2.5 inches off the ground, which is perfect for outdoorsy pants with Blundstones so the bottoms don’t get wet. 

These are the perfect amount of structure to stay put and be flattering while also allowing sooo much movement. I have two little kids and I have no probably bending down and running in these. The lining is like the inside of a sleeping bag. Very soft and warm even on just skin. 

I first bought a size large so I could layer sweaters underneath. However 75% of the straps are elastic and while you can probably use that part to adjust the size, I think once you pass the metal clip onto Elastic, it doesn’t go back to the canvas well. In the end I went with a medium which is way more flattering and cute. I wear a warm fitted wool shirt underneath and top it off with a down jacket. There isn’t room anymore for a thick underlayer but I found the fitted fit to be much more comfortable. Like a glove. I will be wearing these allll winter long
review.name: Perfection

review.reviewBody: I have a pair of short overalls that I use for DIY home projects, gardening, camping, all the things where you need a durable fabric, comfortable bottoms, and pockets that hold everything. It's cold out & still needed to be outside and continue projects. I was on the hunt for warm overalls with a great sturdy fabric. I found them with the Women's Jackson Ridge Bib! My legs stay warm while I move and work on different projects outdoors. I'm not afraid to get them a little dirty & they're breaking in so nicely. I love these & super happy I finally bought them. Don't hesitate, save yourself frustration of not having a warm set of functional, stylish overalls. :)
review.name: Just get 'em, you'll love them!

review.reviewBody: My wife enjoys how the bibs keep her warm during cold days when we're out hiking or camping.
review.name: Great Bibs!

review.reviewBody: Thrilled to find a pair of coveralls that are lined and good sturdy fabric - perfect for camping and garden work in the colder months!
review.name: This Bib is the Bomb

name: Jackson Ridge Bib - Women's

review.reviewBody: I have 3 other R1 Air pieces, the Full Zip Hoody and 2 Half Zip Pullovers; and wanted at least one of these for the cusp between indoors & outdoors.  Last year, a 3rd party review said R1 Air offered the best thermoregulation of any fleece on the market, and I would not quibble with that assessment.  You will feel comfortable indoors if it's a little chilly and yet - magically - nice and warm down into the 30s outdoors.  I guess people use these R1 Air garments for exercise, since they are SO breathable; I live in Northern Florida so I do not have such a situation, so I can't comment.  All I can say is: I have R1, R1 Techface and R1 Air in my closet, and this is the BEST iteration of R1 in Patagonia's lineup - full stop.  Be forewarned: if you get one R1 Air, it won't be your last!
review.name: Comfy Across A Wide Temperature Range

name: R1 Air Crew Top - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Metro II WP Sneak Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I'm glad I bought these on sale as they were a huge disappointment.  It's not as if I wore them to the top of Mount Hood in 8 feet of snow.  I only wore them on a couple walks with my dog in light rain and damp grass.  Terrifically UN-waterproof.  Save yourself some money and strap a couple of plastic bags around your feet as I  imagine that would be far more waterproof than these knock off converse.  They are comfortable though.
review.name: Disappointing but comfortable

review.itemreviewed: Metro II WP Sneak Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I recently purchased these shoes. They fit nicely when I tried them on in the store. However, the first time I walked in them, the inside seam at the heel of the left shoe rubbed the skin on my heel raw and bloody. This is with socks on. The shoes are of poor design and quality, with little, to no padding on the exposed inside seam in the heel. The seam protrudes enough to rub on my skin with every step, even when wearing good socks.
review.name: Inside Seam at Heel Rubs Skin Raw

review.reviewBody: Size correct as with all van’s consistent with other orders
review.name: Always good with vans

review.reviewBody: Bought these for CrossFit workouts - they are great. Probably wouldn’t recommend for straight up weight lifting, but for everything else they are very nice.
review.name: Good workout shoe

review.reviewBody: Super comfy in the gym or on the street, lives up to Vans standards
review.name: Great for anything & everything

review.reviewBody:
I bought the Vans MTE UltraRange as I was after a all round travel shoe that was comfortable enough to wear all day while exploring Singapore and Thailand, yet casual enough I could wear them to dinner to dinner without looking like a jogger.

These shoes have truely surpassed my expectations. The grip on the base was an unexpected feature. And was able to scale a steep uncut dirt track with trouble too.

These will now become my go to everyday sneakers. I think I will get another set in another colourway.
review.name: My new everyday all day sneakers 👟

review.reviewBody: These Vans are excellent. They are extremely light and great to wear. Ordering online was easy and delivery was extremely fast. Very happy with the product and the service. Highly recommend.
review.name: Excellent

review.reviewBody: Love them, bought two pairs! Super comfy and soft souled. Reasonably durable also
review.name: Love them, bought two pairs!

review.reviewBody: These shoes are so comfortable but still give the nice look of traditional vans. Highly recommend for anyone else over 30!
review.name: Elder Emo Godsend

review.reviewBody: They fot great and are so comfy to wear! Definitely adding to my concert wardrobe
review.name: Awesome

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable, lightweight, love the bright colors
review.name: Great

review.reviewBody: Straight up best shoes ever, light weight, comfortable, zero break in time. Plus they look hot
review.name: My go to for everything

review.reviewBody:
Very high quality, extremely warm parka. Its literally a wearable heater.

Its made of very lightweight materials, but the insulation is thick, so it only packs down to a medium size compared to down. The outer layer is thin... Don't expect the durability of Cordura®. But its durable enough for its purpose as an extreme weather belay parka.

Its definitely a bit oversized. I'm assuming that's so you can throw it over whatever you already have on (while dangling from the side of a mountain), but it still works if you have minimal layers underneath. (The model in that picture is surely wearing a size S.)

If you want an extreme weather coat and like the design aesthetic of lightweight climbing gear, buy the DAS Parka!

My only big complaint about this jacket is that the collar doesn't come up high enough when zipped all the way up (w/ hood up or down). This causes your neck and chin to be exposed to the elements. Most of Patagonia's similar insulated jackets have a collar that's 2-3 inches higher, and you can tuck your chin into when the wind is blowing, etc.
review.name: Wearable Heater

review.reviewBody: I was waiting for cold weather to try it out and it performed very well -9 F. I wore a base layer top, hoodie and my DAS Parka and I was warm in -9 F.
review.name: Warm in frigid temperatures

review.reviewBody: Managed to find a medium in stock. Got it, threw it on ready to have found the one here. It must have added 20-30 pounds to my frame. I run a medium for everything in Patagonia and this was just huge on me. Probably not the intended buyer. Seems like a quality item over all. Just runs big in my view. Order different sizes and return those that don't work would be my suggestion.
review.name: Seemed warm, compacted well, ran large

name: DAS Parka - Men's

hasVariant.name: Winter Neoprene Glove - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Giordana Winter Neoprene Glove - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I would say these are probably good for a particular temperature range... not related to winter.  Recently used them on a 50 degree day and hands after a fairly short time got cold.  Used them today in 40 degrees with wind and fingers went completely numb at the fingertips.  That being said, I would like to try them with Pogies and see if they pair up well.

I'm not sure 3mm neoprene works as a great insulating layer against cold moving air.

I have yet to try them at slightly warmer temps and with wet weather, in which case I think they would have utility.  

I also have the 45NRTH Sturmfist.  These have kept my hands toasty warm.
review.name: Would not use for winter.

name: Winter Neoprene Glove - Men's

hasVariant.name: Vapor Carbon 2 Ski Poles
hasVariant.description: Buy the Black Diamond Vapor Carbon 2 Ski Poles online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: The poles are great! Extremely light and easy to adjust for different conditions
review.name: New poles

review.reviewBody: Love the extended foam grip. I do wish the very top was rubber or more “grippy” when I use it to adjust my risers. Love the simple design of the handles. Overall very happy with them and in fact have already bought my wife a pair. Great poles!
review.name: Lightweight

review.reviewBody: The swing weight is divine and the flip locks are trustworthy!! Great poles!!
review.name: Great, sturdy touring pole!!

review.reviewBody: Love how light it is when I use alot during whistler! It doesn't fold fit in backpack but still retractable. The paint scrap off very easily but actually looks very cool . Bright green is great for safety too. Highly recommended if want lightweight pole yet strong
review.name: So light !

review.reviewBody: Lock doesn’t hold. Strap comes off easily, and does not go back together without creative engineering. Grip is minimal, insufficient for me. Hard to justify the expense.
review.name: Disappointed

review.reviewBody:
This was a want purchase and I have no regrets. These are the lightest poles I’ve carried and I love the foam grips. 
I have the older carbon poles and didn’t think they could get much lighter, I was wrong.
 The reviews about the paint are right , it chips off easily but I don’t care so much about looks as performance. 
The wrist straps were easy to take off but I had to figure it out. There are no directions for that process. 
Love love love these, definitely worth it.
review.name: Need or want

review.reviewBody:
I like the changes in the new Carbon Vapor 2 from my previous all Carbon poles. I like the longer foam handle, sturdier flint lock mechanism and light weight. 

As usual, solid simple gear! Cheers Terry
review.name: Vapor Carbon 2

review.reviewBody: This is my first set of ski poles and extremely pleased with quality and craftsmanship.
review.name: Extremely light and comfortable.

review.reviewBody: Ok, after 20 years out of albinism, a group of us ole timers planned a Rainier trip. In preparation, I bought these poles and did a few practice hikes. Big problems: 1) I had gained so much weight my pack didn't fit 2) nor did my gore-tex, 2) my knees and foot hurt so much it was nearly unbearable 3) much lesser folks pasted me with ease and kept asking if I was too hot or needed a rescue. As for the poles, the did not help me lose weight, and my wife and I still argue about watching YouTube videos of the Disappointment Clever at training. Anyway, yeah the poles, well they are hiking poles so in no possible way do they replace marriage therapy, fitness, sobriety, or moral values. But guys, please, please remember climbing is the source; it’s more than having fun. The poles are fine. Have some guts and publish this review.
review.name: ok poles but...

review.reviewBody: The adjustments worked great even when in -25. The numbers are already chipping off after one expedition
review.name: The adjustments worked great even

name: Vapor Carbon 2 Ski Poles

review.reviewBody: An upgrade to my fav combo, lined gauntlets, bike all year, made to climb, leashes & pull loops, tan easy to find, new cinches
review.name: Latest lined gauntlet gnice upgrades to wear out

review.reviewBody: I use these exclusively for skiing. I live on the West Coast of Canada and primarily ski at Whistler, therefore in wet/windy conditions a lot. These gloves are pretty warm and the wrist straps are awesome for ease-of-use when having to take the gloves off. Biggest downside is the Waterproofness. These are gore-tex gloves, but your hands still get wet after a day of skiing in wet snow conditions. I wasn't terribly impressed with this as OR states that the are 5/5 for waterproofness (I would hate to see what anything less than 5/5 would be if this is the case). The gloves look cool, but are quite bulky and therefore I often have to take my hands out if I want to do anything precise (eg. do up my bindings, etc.). Not a bad buy, but the fact my hands get wet when I ski with these is a pretty big bummer.
review.name: Good not Great

review.reviewBody: I would usually were a large but I sized up and am glad I did. I tend to find OR gloves fit on the smaller side. Have taken them skating, skiing and out for a winter walk. So far so good.
review.name: Super warm and comfortable

review.reviewBody: I like the leather material covering hand which is durable and strong against scratch. The fabric covering wrist and lower arm, however, is easily ripped. On the first day on skiing, it was ripped when I fell. It should have been more thick and strong fabric. The inner parts of the glove easily separated from shell and coming out with hand when I take it off after skiing. I have to be careful and hold the fingertip tightly especially when my hand has moisture after 2 hours of skiing.
review.name: Good glove but still has some room for improvement.

review.reviewBody: Good quality but the favric part need stronger material. I ripped it on first day on skiing.
review.name: Good quality

review.reviewBody: Great gloves. Kept me warm and dry while skiing. Low dexterity but that's to be expected with beefy gloves. I personally would go for mittens if below -20c but my hands get cold easily.
review.name: Great gloves

review.reviewBody: Lots of tech in the glove. Lots of features and solidly well built. Perfect for snowboarding in the mountains to do and undo your bindings. The black leather portion of the glove is water proofed and feels warm. A bit pricey but in line with other brands.
review.name: Very nice gloves using for snowboarding

review.reviewBody: I like the wrist strap that you can choose to use or tuck away inside the glove.
review.name: Good Design

review.reviewBody: These keep my hands warm and toasty during long days out in the snow Skiing with these are great, my fingers stayed dry the whole day. The arcade belt collaboration is a nice touch too Got a medium and they fit perfect.
review.name: Fantastic for long days skiing

review.reviewBody: An everyday skiing glove. I used these at a resort as well as in the backcountry. They are warm and fit well. The leash is a must when you need to pull them off. The gloves have enough flex in them so your hands don't get cramped trying to overcome stiff leather. Terrific purchase.
review.name: Terrific purchase

name: Carbide Sensor Glove - Men's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I ordered pants, they were very long and very baggy. I tried to order regular as the website said they were available. I used gift card but the points were not put back on my gift card. It has been 3 weeks and I am still awaiting the credit.
review.name: No product to rate

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I always wear large, but with these I went with medium and they are about right, but quite roomy. The suspenders are not effectively adjustable as they use Velcro that has minimal adjustment. They need the plastic buckle adjusters. I had to sew the suspenders to make them fit properly. The scuff guards are only two inches high, so either the cuff of the pant is going to get ripped by skis or I will have to sew my own on. Material is quite thin with no reinforced knee or butt, so they will probably wear out fairly quickly. Nice pockets, but perhaps overkill because I usually just use them to carry my wallet when I go to the store, so the effort on the pockets could have been put to better use in the areas I mentioned. No side zips if you want that. Zip vents in the crotch that don't look particularly effective for ventilation. If I bought these at the grocery store $80 they would be highly recommended, but for over $300 I don't think so.
review.name: A few issues, but I'll keep them

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The reviews mentioning how relaxed they are weren't kidding. I'm swimming in these even over a heavy layer. 6'3" 170lbs; medium long. These are for tree trunk legs. SO BAGGY but very nice otherwise.
review.name: Very Nice. VERY Baggy.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Incredible pants, very comfortable and lightweight. I use them for skiing, and they met all my expectations in terms of quality, design, and comfort. Very satisfied!
review.name: i would definitely buy this product again and I recommend it

review.reviewBody: Review just got deleted because TNF wanted me to disable the ad blockers so I'm going to try to do this quick. Good: full cuff surround kickpatches, folding top cargo pockets by about half an inch to help prevent snow and water ingress. Bad: insanely baggy, I'm usually 32 or 34 w / 32 l, and 6' 175 lbs... I can stick an arm down my pants and the whole leg is just too baggy. Suspenders are too long to be useful as well. I find it hard to believe I'm a small but I guess I'll give them a try.
review.name: Too baggy, otherwise nice for snowboarders

review.reviewBody: These pants are extremely relaxed in their fit and are really aimed at someone who needs extra layering options. I am sending these back as they do not fit my needs, but really are a great pant. One thing to note, is that the short is a great size for someone who is 5'8"-5'10", they are the perfect length.
review.name: Wow these are "RELAXED"

name: Sidecut GTX Pant - Men's

description: Buy the Evoc Hip Pouch 1L online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Hip Pouch 1L
hasVariant.description: Buy the Evoc Hip Pouch 1L online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
As someone who always rides with a hip bag, I’ve owned many but this one is the best. The pack holds keys, phone and all my bike paraphernalia while the side pockets hold park passes and energy chews in the perfect place.
The added pads on belt not only keep you cooler and allow air circulation but also provide some protection when going OTB on your bike.
review.name: Best Hip Bag Out There

review.reviewBody: I purchased this to replace my dog's treat training bag since it wasn't very comfortable and didn't have room for anything besides treats for our hikes. This is PERFECT!  It holds my phone, a dog-treat pouch, tick key, doodoo bags, house keys, taser, and bear spray and I still have room for more on the zippered side pockets, and stretchy mesh compartments on the front.  I attached an LED light to the black tab on the front for dusk/night walks. The comfort of the Evoc 1L hip pouch is amazing; it does not get weighted down and pull, and the pads offer great stability so it doesn't sag. It is indeed cool while wearing (we've been having 80ºF - 90ºF weather with 90% humidity) with a breathable waist band, and the clip is definitely strong. I am confident I will be using this for years!  German-engineered too, and you cannot go wrong with that!
review.name: Fantastic! Comfortable & cool

review.reviewBody: It's a minimal bag/pouch, but holds my phone, keys, multi-tool and more if I needed it.  I like the zippered pockets on the hips for easy access to energy gels/chews.  The "bump outs" on the back keep the bag from being fully against the back for comfort and a little less hot.  Trail riding in FL is hot most of the year, so getting a full pack off my back makes a world of difference.
review.name: Great for MTB in Florida summer

review.reviewBody:
Love this little bag. The style is simple and, well, beautiful, to me.  The 1L size works   perfectly for the few items I have. 
 And the biggest surprise is its comfort. It has little pads in the back with open space for  air. Outstanding design in every way. For a man or a woman.
review.name: A Beauty

name: Hip Pouch 1L

review.itemreviewed: Color Puro Limited Edition Long-Sleeve Jersey - Men's
review.reviewBody: Rating is largely because of sizing. The tech specs above says "relaxed fit". The actual jersey has a tag from Santini that literally says "Slim Fit". Now to Santini's credit, I actually agree that this is "slim", it's not a "race fit", it's slim enough to not have loose fabric flapping in the wind, but not so tight that you need the physique of a world tour professional road racer to even breathe in it. But if I had known it was a slim and not a relaxed, I probably would not have ordered this as I was looking for something to wear on lazy century rides where there are lengthy and numerous cafe interruptions throughout the day. Loose flapping fabric is sometimes ok, it's what people like me actually want sometimes. But it's close enough that I'm going to keep it. Even though CC dropped the price by $40 moments after I bought it and I'm feeling salty about that too.
review.name: Product fit is incorrect

name: Color Puro Limited Edition Long-Sleeve Jersey - Men's

hasVariant.name: XX1 Eagle 12-Speed Chain

hasVariant.name: XX1 Eagle 12-Speed Chain
hasVariant.description: Buy the SRAM XX1 Eagle 12-Speed Chain online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I always get the XX1 gold or rainbow color chain.. they look awesome and they last longer than any other chain in my opinion made in Portugal.. quality!!
review.name: Best 12 speed chain on the market

review.reviewBody: This new XX1 chain is so much lighter than the NX chains I have been using on my bike for the last few years. I love the matching gold to the cassette I just picked up. Maybe it’s overkill, but it’s cool ;) It sure shifts better on an X01 drivetrain than an NX drivetrain with the NX chain.
review.name: Matches SRAM gold cassette well

review.reviewBody: Quality of the chain is a given, Sram makes amazing components and their warranty is on point. In regards to the purchase through MotorSport, it was convenient, price was extremely competitive and communication was over the top, highly recommended the component and the reseller, this website is loaded with parts for all of your ridding needs and specialists to help with any questions or concerns.
review.name: Simplicity of purchase

review.reviewBody: The chain was perfect for what I needed, I really liked being able to pickup from the Local store so I could have it same day.
review.name: Eagle Chain XX1

name: XX1 Eagle 12-Speed Chain

description: Buy the Wahoo Fitness Speedplay Easy Tension Cleat online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Speedplay Easy Tension Cleat
hasVariant.description: Buy the Wahoo Fitness Speedplay Easy Tension Cleat online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: these are fantastic cleats, highly recommend!! especially for us newbies to clip in pedals! :-)
review.name: Cleats are Awesome!

review.reviewBody: Cleats are very easy to clip in and out. Must be diligent during installation, cleats must be perfectly level for proper operation.
review.name: Best for New riders

review.reviewBody: Perfect Just what I needed. The standard cleats were difficult for me to consistently and easily clip in & out (me issue). Once I got these cleats properly setup these are perfect for me
review.name: Easy release cleats

review.reviewBody: Great cleat for people who struggle un-clipping at stops.
review.name: Great cleat for people who

review.reviewBody: I have used Speedplay pedals for decades. My knees do better with a bit more float. But I noticed a few years ago that the newer cleats rust and wear out very quickly. I still have some older cleats that are just fine, but new ones rust within a few weeks.
review.name: Great clear system, poor longevity.

review.reviewBody: Seem lighter weight than the original speedplay version. Anxious to see how they hold up. Lighter is better of course.
review.name: Is Lighter Better?

review.reviewBody: I purchased these Yahoo cleats AND pedals to replace a 15-year-old pair of Speedplay pedals. I've used them for a couple of months and I ride 2 or 3 times a week. Just like the originals, it takes a while to break the new ones in so that they clip in easily but after that, they're the greatest.
review.name: Easiest cleat to use

review.reviewBody: These cleats are the best. I like the fact that they have adjustable play and you can get in and out easily.
review.name: These cleats are the best.

review.reviewBody: I bought these Easier in cleats hoping to not put as much strain on my knees clipping in. They do clip in a little easier… but i accidentally unclipped 3 times on one ride. I should have stuck with the standard Black cleats. Live and learn i guess….. I don’t use them.
review.name: Wahoo cleats

review.reviewBody: I bought these cleats when i purchased my POWERLINK ZERO Single-sided Bike Power Pedals, I am glad I did. I put on the original cleats that came with the POWERLINK and thought they would unclip easily. I rode the bike and as I was coming to a stop I had to really fight to get my foot unclipped. Glad iwas in front of my house and not on the road. I immediately switched and put on the Easy Tension cleats and it was night and day. The Easy Tension cleats work really well and I am very happy with them.
review.name: Easy Tension Cleats to the Rescue

name: Speedplay Easy Tension Cleat

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Thanks to global warming...this is now my winter coat!
review.name: Perfect fit!

review.reviewBody: I was looking for a light weight rain jacket and this fits the bill
review.name: Lightweight Rain Jacket

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Simple lovely! Beautiful jacket, it fits perfect. I’m 1,73m and 75kg, size M fitted pretty well!
review.name: Amazing jacket!

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Overall, is a great option for casual use and light rain, but it may not be the best choice for heavy-duty outdoor activities.

Pros:
Affordable Price: It's budget-friendly, making it accessible for most people.

Stain-Resistant: The Omni-Shield coating helps resist stains and keeps the jacket looking clean.

Lightweight: It's easy to carry around and pack away.

Waterproof: The Omni-Tech technology provides reliable waterproof protection.

Windproof: It also offers wind protection, making it suitable for various weather conditions.

Easy to Pack: It can be packed into its own hand pocket, making it convenient for travel.

Cons:
Breathability: It's not very breathable, which can be uncomfortable during intense activities.

Limited Waterproofing: While it handles light rain well, it may not be suitable for heavy downpours.
review.name: Lightweight, comfortable, and travel-friendly.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Exactly what you need for a little pack, just got to test it with rain, but just what I was looking for.
review.name: Great purchase

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This jacket has been a game-changer for me! It's incredibly lightweight, making it easy to carry everywhere, and its waterproof performance keeps me completely dry even during heavy rains. The stylish design and durable build make it perfect for both outdoor adventures and everyday use. Columbia has truly nailed it with this one—practicality and quality in one package!
review.name: Stay Dry, Stay Stylish!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is my second time buying this jacket. I love how lightweight it is and packable. It keeps you warm but also very breathable. Deep sea fishing in Canada to Donner pass snow to regular rain in Southern California. Fits right (L - 5,10”-190lbs) zipper pockets are awesome. I honestly recommend this to people.
review.name: I recommend this jacket to people

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] It is comfortable to wear and fits great. I like it!
review.name: Great!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The jacket fits perfectly so true to size! It helps keep the rain out nice for a walk and lightweight.
review.name: Fit

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Looks great, it’s not warm just a thin protection against rain and some wind, large was too loose for me, I’m 6’1 194lbs the medium fits me well, looks good with a suit/work stuff etc
review.name: Quality light rain jacket

review.itemreviewed: Silver Ridge Utility Convertible Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: Very nice pants but are not durable.   The stitching holding the back pockets could not withstand less than 10 wearings.  The majority of the time worn was standing and fishing on a boat. I would not buy them again.
review.name: These pants won't last one season or wearing.
comment: Thank you so much for taking the time to provide your feedback! We will make sure this is passed along to the appropriate teams regarding opportunities for improvement on this product. Thank you for choosing Columbia!

review.itemreviewed: Silver Ridge Utility Convertible Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] excellent pants, comfortable, fresh and ready l for action
review.name: Confortable

review.itemreviewed: Silver Ridge Utility Convertible Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: Great idea and I original loved the pants. Bought them beginning of summer and used them as shorts. Then when I went to zip the legs back on, the shorts had totally faded, and I had two tone pants! Buyer beware! Should have just bought shorts and pants separately.
review.name: Buyer beware!
comment: Thank you so much for taking the time to provide your feedback! We will make sure this is passed along to the appropriate teams regarding opportunities for improvement on this product. Thank you for choosing Columbia!

review.itemreviewed: Silver Ridge Utility Convertible Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: I bought 3 pairs a couple of years ago and loved the fit and function.  I decided to buy an extra pair to wear for my job as a trainer.  The pants I purchased a few days ago arrived today and I soon discovered, they are not the same pants.  Same name, same material, same convertible option but the size is much wider in the legs, left lower pocket has changed. It now has a vertical zipper.  I'm 5'10", 180 lbs. and I drown in these pants.  I will be returning.
review.name: Way Too Big For Standard Size
comment: Hey there! We are really sorry these pants didn't hit the mark for you. We would love to assist with finding something that works better. Please feel free to reach out to our Customer Care team if you need further assistance, or exact measurements!

review.itemreviewed: Silver Ridge Utility Convertible Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I used these pants for part of a thru-hike of the PCT, meaning I used them every single day for hours a day, so I have a good idea of what the pants can take. The convertibility function itself is good and I find the fit to be good enough. However, the durability is the worst of any hiking pant I've ever owned. Within only days, almost every pocket had a hole, meaning I would lose small items. Besides the pockets I have literally gotten six different holes in these pants. Some of the holes are due to stitching coming undone and some of them are the pants easily tearing. The problem is exacerbated by the fabric having completely zero stretch or give, which is not ideal for any less than walking conditions. The pants do not stand up to wear and tear. Also, the fabric itself, despite being light and easily tearable, chafes my skin and causes awful blistering. Similar pants from other brands do not cause any of these issues. I think the silver ridge utility shirts are the literal number one of any hiking shirt on the market, and have stood up incredibly well, but I would stay far away from the pants.
review.name: Terrible durability, bad flexibility, skin issues
comment: Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us, we will be sure to pass this information to the appropriate teams for future improvement.

review.itemreviewed: Silver Ridge Utility Convertible Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought a couple pair of these as the non-utility silver ridge were not available. On receiving I found the pants were an inch wider in the leg. Too baggy so I returned them. Would have been helpful if the description stated that.
review.name: Baggy legs

review.itemreviewed: Silver Ridge Utility Convertible Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought three pairs of these pants and wore them exclusively on a backpacking trip around the world. A couple years, 40 countries, and 7 continents later, all three pairs are showing minor wear and tear. The mesh pockets get holes fairly easily and after a couple years, the seams are starting to come apart. But considering the mileage, they have been phenomenal. I decided to get three more pairs to replace them, and I have immediate thoughts on the updated pants. 
Pros: First, the belt is wider and much improved on the previous model. Secondly, the pocket mesh seems thicker, so hopefully it won’t be so prone to holes. 
Con: The zippered pocket on the left leg used to be perfect for a passport. I carried it in that pocket religiously and the new pocket has been changed to a smaller side opening deal, which is less than ideal. 
Not sure yet: The pants seem to be made of a new material and I don’t know if that’s good or bad. Time will tell. Otherwise, I’ve never felt so comfortable in a pair of pants and if you’re a traveler, hot or cold, mountain or desert, these things are as reliable as they come.
review.name: New changes to an old friend

review.itemreviewed: Silver Ridge Utility Convertible Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] A really sad, paltry shadow of the previous (?) Silver Ridge Utility Pants.  If these are just a different pant, then change the name, for God’s sake! I was duped into buying these thinking I was completing my collection with the always elusive blue ones. Terrible mistake. Horrible, cheap fabric; poor workmanship, shallow pockets. A poor replacement of the original Silver Ridge I really like! Big blunder, Columbia, and a very unhappy customer.
review.name: Horrible pants!
comment: Thank you for taking the time to write your review. We appreciate you as a Columbia customer and your feedback is what helps us improve. Please reach out if you need further assistance.

review.itemreviewed: Silver Ridge Utility Convertible Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I wore these pants for about 4 days from the time they were brand new and somehow there is a tair in the back left pocket . I have reached back to put my car keys in the pocket and they go down my pant leg to the ground.  The pocket lining should be tougher .
review.name: Stronger pockets needed

name: Silver Ridge Utility Convertible Pant - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Chandler CNX Hiking Shoe - Little Boys'
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These are the only shoes that can withstand use by my 5-year-old for more than a month or two. He wears them every single day and they've held up. We just keep buying them as he outgrows them.
review.name: Sturdy, comfortable, durable

review.itemreviewed: Chandler CNX Hiking Shoe - Little Boys'
review.reviewBody: My 3 1/2 year old can put these on by himself. He enjoys wearing them and they worked great before all the snow. Now these will hopefully still fit in the spring.
review.name: 3yr old approved

review.itemreviewed: Chandler CNX Hiking Shoe - Little Boys'
review.reviewBody: The shoes last wonderfully. The strap does not. Within 2 weeks, the velcro started separating from the strap. Not the first pair of kids Keens that have done this.
review.name: Great shoe but the velcro separates from the strap

review.itemreviewed: Chandler CNX Hiking Shoe - Little Boys'
review.reviewBody: I love these shoes, but our second pair just broke. The ring that anchors the velro strap pulls off the shoe. Everything else about them has been great, but I cannot justify buying another pair.
review.name: Great shoes, but the strap breaks

review.itemreviewed: Chandler CNX Hiking Shoe - Little Boys'
review.reviewBody: Of all the kids shoes I have bought my son in his short 4 (almost 5) years, these Keens easily held up the best of the various brands we tried and saw many hours of play on the playground and at preschool. They were still in such great shape once he outgrew them that they are seeing a second life with his younger cousin.
review.name: Just Bought Our Third Pair

review.itemreviewed: Chandler CNX Hiking Shoe - Little Boys'
review.reviewBody: I have such a hard time finding shoes that my toddler likes that fit well and are durable—but these fit the bill! Easy on and off, like an all-year version of the sandals she loved so much.
review.name: So far, so good!

review.itemreviewed: Chandler CNX Hiking Shoe - Little Boys'
review.reviewBody: Shoes fit well, and are comfortable for my boys. I have a 4 and 5 year old who love keen shoes, we continue to buy this style as we replace the old shoes with new shoes
review.name: Excellent shoes!

review.itemreviewed: Chandler CNX Hiking Shoe - Little Boys'
review.reviewBody: We highly recommend these shoes for toddlers as they are durable, easy to put on and take off, and they look so cute. The bonus is that they have amazing customer service and I would shop here over and over again especially because of it.
review.name: Great shoe for toddlers & stellar customer service

review.itemreviewed: Chandler CNX Hiking Shoe - Little Boys'
review.reviewBody: This is my son’s 3rd pair of cnx chandler and the Velcro doesn’t last at all - Velcro will come off after 3 months of usage. The shoe is still in good condition but not the Velcro. Hope the R&D team fixes this issue on the Velcro. Not sure if this under a warranty as I bought the last pair of shoes less than a year ago.
review.name: Velcro doesn’t last at all

review.itemreviewed: Chandler CNX Hiking Shoe - Little Boys'
review.reviewBody: Bought these for my kids to play in. True rubber soles with solid traction and construction. Toes are rigid which prevents stubbed toes and tripping when running. Really love them. Seem true to size. I will buy these again.
review.name: Awesome kids shoes

name: Chandler CNX Hiking Shoe - Little Boys'

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] It may be shameful, but I buy two pair of these pants every year because I sometimes wear them daily in the winter months. I love that I don’t have to mess with zippers, snaps or buttons! These pants are so soft and comfortable on the inside and wind resistant on the outside!
review.name: The pants to have if you love the cold outdoors!

review.reviewBody: I purchased at least 3 different pairs of these in the past two years as I love them. This year I only purchased one pair because I liked the blue color better than last years. To my surprise the pant style and material are new and improved. They seem warmer to me than previous years kind. I also like the tightening ability on the bottom of legs.
review.name: New and improved

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love the high waisted with straight legs. The fleece inside is warm but not to warm to wear indoors.
review.name: Great for indoors and outdoors

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love the high waisted with straight legs. The fleece inside is warm but not to warm to wear indoors.
review.name: Nice winter pants for indoors and outdoors

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I really liked the previous version, so I wanted to buy some more, but they changed the pants ever so slightly. Not a fan of the changes. Still keeping the pants.
review.name: Great pants don't need improvement

review.reviewBody: I purchased these pants a week ago and I love them! I am 5ft 8in. 145lbs and mediums fit great. My only complaint is that they don't have more colors.
review.name: My favorite hiking pants

review.reviewBody: Bought these last weekend. I am 5ft 8in. 145lbs. the medium fit great and keep me warm. comfortable for sure. Wish they came in a army green color too!
review.name: my favorite hiking pants

review.reviewBody: I bought this bag to be an all around bag for travel. The convertible function is cool. However the fabric is garbage. Patagonia sells outdoor gear. The black fabric was picking up lint and a white hue just on the flight. Used it for a day at the beach. Sand clings to the bag and it has a cast all over. I have Patagonia sun shirts and shorts that are sun and sand friendly. This fabric on this bag is ruined after one use.  Major regrets!!
review.name: Horrible fabric

review.reviewBody: I have used this a couple of times and so far it’s ok. I can not get the chest strap adjusted so it’s comfortable for long hikes.
review.name: Well made

review.reviewBody: I bought this to lug around Europe and it was absolutely perfect - we used it for a daily bag / beach bag / carry on bag. Would HIGHLY reccommend!
review.name: Best Packable Bag EVER

review.reviewBody: This bag is quite versatile.  Easily carried with handles or used as a backpack. Very functional and like all Patagonia products,  well made with beautiful fabric. Lots of compartments for "stuff".
review.name: Great Bag/Backpack

review.reviewBody: Brought this to pack for a trip and use as a beach bag.  Folds small and opens to a perfect size.  Zipper compartments make searching for important things easy!!  Blue is a great bright color.   Great quality.  I know I’ll get tons of use.
review.name: Great 👍🏻

review.reviewBody: I had an older model of this convertible shoulder/backpack but was always frustrated that the front-pocket zipper was vertical -- it was awkward to dump stuff into it, and stuff kept falling out if it wasn't zipped up. Checked Patagonia and this better version exists (horizontal zipper, you can just drop stuff into it), kept googling and suddenly Backcountry had this model in the color I'd chosen and ON (big) SALE! Fine service, it arrived promptly and is just great.  I'm impressed. I wish it stood up a bit better on its own, but I hang it from a doorknob.
review.name: Fine daily bag

review.reviewBody: I bought this for my baby to use as her diaper bag as we really don’t like the design or look of traditional bags. It has been awesome! It has enough pockets for some organization, side water bottle pockets on the outside, padded straps, and super lightweight material. The only thing I wish it had was a small waist strap, but again, it’s really not designed to be heavy duty. I would definitely recommend this to others as an alternative to a regular diaper bag.
review.name: Great for alternative diaper bag!

review.reviewBody: We actually use this as a diaper bag for our four and two year old. We can hold diapers wipes changes of clothes and a foldable toilet seat in it. It fits on the stroller well and is easy to wash.
review.name: Greta lightweight bag!

review.reviewBody: This is a fantastic pack but ultimately I have to return because I had hoped it would be sturdier for use as a grocery hauler and I don’t think that is a great idea. It does have a sternum strap and would make a great beach bag or travel carry on. But for EDC I am going with a more reinforced bag. This one is good to keep packed in its own pocket inside your other travel bag to use as a day bag, but that is not a use case I have on my bingo card!
review.name: Love this pack!

review.reviewBody: I love this bag! It’s light, rolls up small when I don’t need it, has great features, and the blue is so pretty! Great quality.
review.name: Perfect, light tote/backpack!

review.reviewBody: Purchased primarily for paddleboarding but really made the decision after seeing its fishing pockets. I would highly recommend this PFD for all day comfort. Had it on a few day trips and it fits great! Mesh lower back is comfortable and allows for breathability. 10/10 would purchase again.
review.name: Love this PFD!

review.reviewBody: I WAS wearing a cheaper vest that bunched up when I sat in the chair on my pontoon boat.  It was uncomfortable and bulky.  The Chinook is truly a PFD made for float fishermen/women.  It is comfortable, fits well and is designed to be worn while sitting down ...without bunching up and poking you in the chin!  It has a nice group of pouches and zippered storage areas.  I would buy again and would recommend this PFD to others.
review.name: Great for Kayak or Pontoon/Float Fishing

review.reviewBody: This is the gold standard of kayaking fishing life jackets. They say PFD stands for Prevents From Drowning. I say, Pretty Flipping Dope. This is thing is so comfy I forget I?m wearing it. The pockets are huge. If I?m using traditional tackle, I can fit multiple soft plastics in each pocket or a small hard case for lures. If I?m fly fishing, then my small fly boxes fit perfect. There?s a pliers holster, that?s rad. A rod holder for when I?m wading or tying. It dries fast, it looks great. I?m a paddler first, and angler second, so I wear PFDs. All the time. This one is by far the best.
review.name: Like a Glove

review.reviewBody: I just updated my original Chinook to the new one (I think it was 2019 that they updated?)  Still has all the fishing needs, large pockets, rod holder, attachment points.  But the new design fits me SO much better.  The foam wraps around my body and it is lower profile as it wraps over my chest, so less under chin.  I am big guy, so it still floats me really high in the water.  (Oh, the little spots to hold your strap ends in place are pretty cool too.)  Great improvements to already great PFD.
review.name: Best fitting Fishing PFD

review.reviewBody: I am an avid kayak fishing tournament angler. This is the best option if you are a serious tournament angler. The pockets allow me to keep all of my go-to tackle and lures organized properly. The main pockets will even accommodate my Z-Man soft plastics bags so I can keep my favorite colors ready to go. And I have used the integrated fishing rod holder several times. If you stand up and sight fish at all you will appreciate this feature.
review.name: An Anglers PFD

name: Chinook Personal Flotation Device - Men's

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] We bought this kayak for my husband’s boss for Christmas. He needed a small water craft to cross the river for hunting. We haven’t gifted it to him yet but from the process to ordering it to delivery it’s been a very smooth, pleasant purchase. My husband thinks his boss will be very happy with it it’s exactly what he was looking for. Very thankful we chose Johnson Outdoors. We hope to buy one for us someday & we Highly recommend this style & company! 
Thank you Johnson Outdoors!
review.name: Highly Recommend

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] love my kayak. great for everyday use and fishing!
review.name: great kayak

review.reviewBody: As a Kayak Fishing Guide and owner of Paddles and Poles Kayak Fishing Tours we cannot say enough about how great these kayaks are. We have 3 PDL 106s and they have been a game changer. We hope to add another to our fleet very soon. If you looking for a great pedal drive with an excellent price point, look no more. If your in the Hilton Head area, look us up to try for yourself! Most clients purchase one after they have been in ours.
review.name: Rugged and reliable day in and day out.

review.reviewBody: Tested out some Hobies and Old Towns today. I liked the Old Town a lot more than the Hobies. Plus they are lighter and cost less. Too bad I couldn’t test drive the power assist model, works like an e-bike.
review.name: Old Town over Hobie

review.reviewBody:
Overall a fantastic kayak with a few minor flaws. I absolutely love the overall appearance, balance, storage, angling features, just to name a few. I had all types of people direct me to Old Town for my new kayak purchase.
 However, in all my reviews I did not hear anything about the amount of water that would come on to the floorboard while trying to deploy the drive system, even with the aftermarket cover I purchased. I was not expecting it and it was kind of upsetting. Also, only two scupper plugs were provided with it and there are a total of 9 scuppers. I kayak all seasons and don't want a floorboard full of water, especially cold, but I'll survive.
Number two (two part complaint): I don't understand why the pdl version only has 2 rail mounts instead of 4 like the motor ones. Second part of this is I had a very difficult time sliding my rail accessories on. It should not have to be a struggle to slide the rail accessories on that are meant to fit on it. 
Number three: I am currently loading this into the bed of my truck, tailgate down and front in first so as not to damage the rudder. In doing so, I'm finding it difficult to locate a good tiedown point near/at the rear of the seat or rear of the kayak in general. I know there is no way to fix that, but it's frustrating that there is no "tiedown points" near the rear. 
With that being said, my overall needs and expectations are met and I'm still very happy with my purchase.
review.name: A few minor things, but an overall happy customer

review.reviewBody:
I am a 78 yr old who recently purchased his first kayak, the Sportsman 106 PDL. I was looking for a kayak to primarily use for nature photography. Considering my age and this would be my first ever kayak, stability was a primary requirement. I wanted to feel comfortable and safe, especially with expensive cameras and lenses. After much online research, I narrowed to Old Town and a couple of other brands. I completed my research with phone calls to the brand customer service reps. Ken Stinson was especially patient with my questions, listened to my desires and concerns and offered honest pros and cons of the Old Town products as related to my stated need. As a result of my online research and Ken's advice, I purchased a Sportsman 106PDL.
 So far I have had it out four times, all in good weather and water conditions. I quickly found my sweet spot for easy continuous peddling. The kayak has amazing stability, allowing me to twist and turn with confidence to get the shot. I also stood in it my first time out and was very surprised at the stability, although I doubt I will stand while shooting. The peddling, with instant reverse allows me to keep my hands free to catch those quick shots. At 101/2 ft, it fits in the bed of my Ford Ranger pickup.  My nature photography and kayaking friend has been amazed by my Sportsman PDL. So far my Sportsman 106PDL has exceeded my expectations.
review.name: Great Platform For Nature Photography

review.reviewBody: I bought mine about three weeks ago and have been out in it a lot and i absolutely love it. It is the sturdiest kayak I’ve ever been in! The PDL drive is easy to pedal and it moves pretty quick too.
review.name: Awesome kayak all the way around!

review.reviewBody: I bought this 3 weeks ago but the cold weather and water in New England kept me off the water until today.   What a pleasure .  My last kayak was a good one . It was a 13 fooot LLBean rebranded Perception sit in kayak with a better than average seat and two rod holders. It was a good kayak but for fishing it lacked . Plenty stable for kayaking but don’t reach too far for that 2.5 lb bass.  Don’t ask mee how I know. .  I am 6’3””, 240 lbs ( yes my doc doesn’t like that) and 66 years old.  I found the Sportsman 106 PDL to my a dream. Much easier to in and out of, I can move around and really enjoyed the 3 hours I was out on a lake today.  The pedals gave me a good work out .  I loved the instant forward/reverse which allowed me to effortlessly hold the kayak in position while a I fished.   There was slight breeze which didn’t seem to affect the handling . I will report later on a windier day.   There was a bass tournament on the lake today and unlike my last kayak, this one handles the wakes from the 200 hp boats wit aplomb whether the wake hit the stern, bow or sides.  Just makes me feel a whole lot more confident.  As for stability , I stepped off the dock into the kayak and sat down . I was amazed.  I did not try stand up as as one gets older ones stability on terrafirma is not as good as it used to be). I enjoyed this day of fishing ( although I wish I good brag about the fish I caught) more than any day in a kayak.  I was comfortable and could easily move about the boat.  That PDL system is awesome.   I did paddle through shallow water with PDL raise and yes you get some water in the boat but it goes out the scuttles. The two tool wells in the cockpit area are a small thing but make a bid difference. It was great to have the hook remover, fisherman’s tool, line cutter etc close at hand.  Small thing but great idea.  Awesome boat Old Town.  Thank you I hope to get years of pleasure out of this.
review.name: Really enjoyed the maiden voyage.

review.reviewBody:
I have been trying to find a Old Town kayak with PDL for almost two years now.
Why are they impossible to get over here in Sweden/Europe?
We have one dealer but nothing is ever in stock.
review.name: Impossible to find in Sweden/Europe?

review.reviewBody: Covid has been a mixed blessing for us, and probably Old Town as well. In our case, with all the lockdowns going on, we and many more have turned to more outdoor sports. As someone who grew up fishing, kayaks quickly got my interest as the best option to get on the water. Thanks to YouTube I quickly discovered pedal kayaking after many hours, combined with the fact that I'm a Mainer, Old Town rose to the top of the list. I'm 68 so I wanted the smallest and easiest to move and haul around, so the 106 was a no-brainer. The bad part of Covid was that even in Maine these boats are hard to come by. I wanted 2 of the Photic Sportsman PDLs, but in the end could only find 1, plus the older identical boat, the Boreal Topwater. There's not much difference, except the new Sportsman seat is great for a large guy like me rather than the older Topwater seat. Ice went out on my small trout pond 2 weeks ago, and I've been out every nice day so far, can't wait to get on a bigger lake! These boats are so stable, can't wait to try standing and casting!
review.name: Great boat, and hard to find!

name: Sportsman PDL 106 Paddle Kayak

review.reviewBody: The duffel bag was big, roomy, stylish and looks durable. I was hoping there can be a shoulder strap in the next iteration.
review.name: Big and stylish

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I was shocked how big this bag was when we took it out and unpacked it from the little square pouch it came in. I love that it is weather resistant and so durable. It comfortably packed both mine and my husbands items for our weekend camping trip. Definitely would recommend.
review.name: Larger than I expected and very durable

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This alpaca, 60 tote duffel bag is waterproof, holds dirty clothes underneath kind of like a hidden pocket. It’s heavy duty I can fit almost a load of laundry into it if I fold my stuff just right, I highly recommend.
review.name: A lot of storage

review.reviewBody: If your in the market for very heavy duty medium/large duffel this an amazing bag. If your car camping and have it strapped to the roof or in a basket expect it to be very easy to clean off the 10000 mosquitoes stuck to it. The material seems really durable, maybe not water proof because of the zippers but it nearly feels like a river bag. Like all Gregory gear it’s very minimal in weight but it feels like it stop a knife or survive a fall from half dome. The hidden back pack straps are great and in the included storage case works great for a packing cube. The bag itself isn’t super flexible so don’t expect to be able to overfill it and still close the top flap, if you need something more flexible the supply bags work great. Perfect bag for any occasion where expecting bad weather, dust, or just need a really durable bug out bag. The webbing on the side of the bag and the massive pulls are also a great touch.
review.name: Terminator of Duffels

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This Gregory Alpaca 60 duffel bag has the capacity to hold everything you need for a short trip.the pocket for shoes is generous enough for hiking boots with room to spare. The packing cube is a bonus and doubles as a storage case for the bag when not in use. I was able to fit a weeks worth of clothes and hiking boots for my trip with room to spare. The shoulder straps to turn it into a backpack are easy to attach and remove. It really makes unloading a breeze so I can be hands free. I wouldn’t use this on a backpacking trip because it’s not that comfortable on my back but it’s purpose as duffle bag is excellent.
review.name: Holds everything you need

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I am very happy with the Alpaca 60 duffel bag from Gregory. I discovered that the 60 in the product name refers to Liter-volume (It tells how much storage space the product has). This item is perfect for week-long trips, going to the gym, and on airplanes (It will fit in most overhead bins!). The duffel is versatile because it can be carried multiple ways: using the carry straps like a briefcase, slung over one shoulder, or using the removable, padded shoulder straps like a backpack.
   The duffel included things I really liked and set it apart from competing products. One such thing is a packing cube with see-through mesh top for organization. Another feature of the duffel is the expandable end zippered pocket-it keeps dirty gear and clothes separate from the contents in the main compartment. This is an awesome feature because you can keep clean and dirty items separate! 
   The outside of the duffel is water-resistant, TPU-coated, and uses recycled polyester ripstop fabric with heavy-duty 900 denier construction for durability. The bag has a three layer padded bottom, and the internal coating provides weather and abrasion resistance. With a little care this duffel should last years because it's definitely built to be reliable and durable.
review.name: So much room, can hold a lot!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] It’s very durable and spacious. It can also be used as a backpack or duffel bag. Unfortunately I thought my husband would like it but it’s not a canvas material and he doesn’t hike lol
review.name: Hit or miss

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This duffel bag is great and the space it grants is amazing. It is a lot bigger than the previous one I used. I would use a duffel bag to pack clothes when I go on a short trip and the last one I had had less room than this one. This one also has many more compartments inside it which is very useful for storing different things. The design also looks very nice and carrying it isn’t a hassle. I recommend anyone who needs a duffel bag for camping or similar activities to get this one.
review.name: Amazing

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Wow, I’m really impressed with this duffel by Gregory! It is coated and sturdy and looks great! What is more, it comes with a packing cube, tons of functional compartments and zippers. This will be great in the summer when we go camping!
review.name: Super sturdy duffel bag

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I received this bag and am amazed by how big this is and how much i will be able to fit inside. This bag is waterproof so perfect for our camping trips. It had many compartments where i can organize all my clothes, necessities, and whatever else i may bring with me. I can’t wait to pack it up and head out shortly!
review.name: Wow!!

name: Alpaca 60L Duffel Bag

review.reviewBody:
I have fat feet, and finding bike shoes that fit is challenging. I was pleasantly surprised when I put these shoes on because nothing in the description indicates they are wide shoes.  

Because of that luxurious fit, I ordered a pair of MTB shoes. Unfortunately, they are too narrow for my feet, so I have to return them to Competitive Cyclist.

For an inexpensive pair of cycling shoes, the Northwave Core Plus 2 cycling shoes are of great value.

If anyone at Competitive Cyclist reads this, does the "Plus" in the name indicate they have a wider toe box?  I have looked for Northwave shoes listed as "Wide" before and I took a chance on this pair, but I'm glad I did.  Thank you.
review.name: Surprised by Wide Toe Box

review.reviewBody: chose this model because it takes both Mtb and road cleats. My previous NW shoes have been my longer lasting compared to most other brands

review.reviewBody: I love the pattern (blue moss) and features, it's very comfortable fabric, but definitely runs a bit small. I tried both the XS and S and ended up keeping the XS even thought it was a tad tight. The S fit too long. In both sizes the zipper bunches at the waist/stomach because it's a really stiff zipper, so that was also a little annoying. Overall I liked the pattern enough to keep - it's almost perfect.

review.reviewBody: normally I hover between and Small & Medium (I'm a size 6 / 34C).  Ordered the Medium and it was decidedly too small. Returning.
review.name: runs very small

review.reviewBody: I just received this jersey today and haven’t worn it yet. It’s my second Machines for Freedom jersey purchase. I love the colors - brighter in person than the screen conveys. The fit is the same as my long sleeve jersey from this company. Compressive but not constructive. Soooo flattering and the fabric feels slick without feeling cheap. My other jersey is 2 1/2 years into weekly use and still looks and performs amazingly. I expect this one will be the same. It’s expensive but for me, an avid recreational road rider, worth the splurge for a jersey I feel like a million bucks while wearing.
review.name: More vibrant IRL

review.reviewBody:
This jacket isn't as packable as the other sportful hotpack jackets but it's worth a lot more warmth. It's still small enough to strap under my saddle bag and stay out of the way, where its integrated travel sack keeps it safe from road spray. I leave it there throughout the winter to account for the temperamental weather here in the Rockies and it's a terrific backup for the 20% of rides where I guess the wrong wardrobe. I can't say exactly how water proof it is but I care mostly about the wind. The arms are long and clingy, the torso is nicely elastic if not a race fit, and I often forget whether I'm still wearing it.

As with other sportful tops I size up by one.
review.name: Clutch

name: Hot Pack Norain Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody:
Pretty disappointed as the materials seemed perfect for my needs, but these gloves don't come close to fitting. I usually wear a med or large depending on the type / style of gloves. Ordered the large in these and the first thing I noticed is that the opening doesn't expand all that much and has no strap (some people prefer strapless, I know), but with that opening I couldn't get the glove to the point where my thumb would even get in. 
  For a test, my wife who usually wears a size m women's glove tried them, they fit her a bit snug but usable. 

A little upset that I'll have to pay return shipping for a glove that isn't even close to the labeled size.
review.name: So small I couldn't even get it on.

review.reviewBody: Love these gloves.   I haven’t really worn anything like them before.   They have a natural, second skin feel—thin but not flimsy.  Grippy palms.  Feels like heat transfers out of them really well.  Lightweight but functional knuckle padding... my only complaint is the thumbs are a little short for my hands!   Like 2mm more room and they’d be perfect.  Maybe I’m just blessed with rare banana-thumbs.
review.name: Great gloves!

name: MTB 4.0 Lite Glove - Men's

review.reviewBody: Flexible yet with enough support, grippy Vibram sole, wide toe box, lightweight, breathable, and water resistant. Flat out in love with these shoes! Just biked 5 days on the Kettle Valley RailTrail in BC in them and they held up beautifully 👍
review.name: Super comfy multipurpose shoe by Danner

review.reviewBody: Wore it on smaller hikes (less than 10 miles) and even crossed a small river on a waterfall hike in these and they held up well. Great traction and didn?t hold too much water. Super happy with these shoes.
review.name: Awesome shoe

review.reviewBody:
I love this pair of shoes, didn?t need to break in at all. As I am trying to look for alternatives to my boots on easier hikes, trying between different brands of hiking shoes, needing something of good grip and comfort. 

At first when i put these on, I was hesitant as i worried that the back heel wouldn?t be cushioned enough for hikes. But i decided to give it a try. 

I went on 2 hikes, both about 8 miles each on multiple terrains, didn?t slip, didn?t hurt my feet, felt super comfortable walking/hiking on them. Totally in love with these. I also love the color!
review.name: Love these shoes

review.reviewBody: While it is great for shorter hikes(6-7) miles, it gives me a terrible blister on the back of my heel every-time I do a longer hike..The shoes are comfortable, ventilates well. You socks could get pretty dusty with the ventilation holes on the side.  Plenty of traction for all conditions. I use these for shorter hikes and use the mountain 600 for any longer hikes. Feels true to size. I really love them except for the blisters. 4 stars because I really like them and would buy another pair but just wont use them for any hike that is longer than 6,7 miles
review.name: terrible blister on the heel

review.reviewBody: Great lightweight shoe. A little narrow, so I am glad I ordered a 1/2 size up. Not for people with high arches.
review.name: Great shoe!

review.reviewBody: I recently took a trip to Iceland and for the first time decided to only bring a carry on bag. I did a lot of research looking for exactly the right thing for this type of adventure and landed on this bag. I was pleasantly surprised to see how much I could fit in and I loved the extra compartments and features of this particular carry on. It can double as a back pack by easily removing straps from the back. It has a handy top pocket for your washbag or other accessory type items. The handle stows away neatly and the material seems really good quality (waterproof) and durable. I absolutely love it!

review.reviewBody: I'll confirm what another reviewer wrote - the lever itself is very fragile. I was very surprised to have it snap on me without much pressure at all.

review.reviewBody:
for god sakes be careful tightening the bolt for the adjustment on the thumb lever… there is a torque spec of 1Nm and they aren’t lying. When installing, I easily snapped the collar that secures the thumb lever to the bearing. I was just nipping it up using the long end of an Allen wrench (less torque). My fault, just know it’s very delicate. I was able to order a replacement part from Wolftooths website.

Otherwise it is nice, it has direct mount with Tech 4s, and is very adjustable.
review.name: Looks nice, but…

review.reviewBody:
I own half a dozen sleeping bags, this one is by far my favorite. Buy once, cry once; this will cover the bulk of your needs. 
First let's talk about the quality - the is highest end bag I've ever seen, each detailed is perfectly dialed in.  Hood shape is just right, the zipper rarely snags, and the continues baffle allows you to dial the temperature rating up or down. (You can shake all the feathers to rest underneath you when it is hot out, and by sleeping on top of them you'll compress them. When it gets cold, shake all the feathers so they sit on top of the bag - it's like sleeping under a warm cloud). 
Compressed size is also incredible, a little bigger than a nalgene bottle - when you pull it out of the stuff sack it's like a magic trick, and you think "all of this couldn't have possibly fit in there??" 
A note on the down - this is high-end 850 down, so you do need to take care of it. Don't leave the bag stuffed into a stuff sack longer than you need to, dry it out thoroughly after each use, and it'll give you years of service. (Note on down types - I have a few synthetic bags, but also a dry-down bag, and I much prefer the untreated WM down. Dry down for me is sweaty, doesn't breathe well. This bag - it breathes beautifully, keeping your warmer). 
Also a note on keeping your bag clean - get yourself a sleeping bag liner (I like the silk ones). It keeps the oils on your skin from getting into the down, and decreases how often you need to wash the bag. 
Overall - this is the best sleeping bag I've ever owned. Buy one. You won't regret it.
review.name: Over a decade and still going strong

review.reviewBody: I bought two down articles from Western Mountaineering decades ago and so this was a bit nostalgic for me. This sleeping bag is well made and super light. I've used it on a six-day backpacking trip in Yosemite. The first few nights were really comfortable but then the weather got colder and the last two nights required me to wear my jacket and ski cap. I think I'll use this bag down to 40 degrees F or so, but not much colder. My wife borrowed it for an overnight trip and she was comfortable. We both like how much lighter it is than our normal down bags. It's a quality sleeping bag.
review.name: Really nice sleeping bag

review.reviewBody: Yes the price for WM gear is always on the high side but their stuff is the highest quality and I dont think I'll need to update this for a long time. Super light and quite warm.
review.name: Western Mountaineering is quality

review.reviewBody: I've used this sleeping bag in the Citico Creek Wilderness (May, 3 days/2 nights) and in the Wind River Mountains (August, 6 days/5 nights).   I love it.   It was comfortable during my May trip, when nighttime temps were in the 50s and 60s, and kept me warm in the Winds, where we had a couple of nights below freezing.   It only weights 21 oz with the stuff sack, which is 20 oz lighter than my previous 800-fill bag.
review.name: Excellent light weight bag

name: Summerlite Sleeping Bag: 32F Down
