Brought with me to a concert. Just sitting yet, after a few hours I was getting wet. Later I was soaked through. It wasn’t raining hard, it was just constant. Also, at the time this happened I hadn’t used them much but, it was too late to return them. Imagine if I was on a multi day hike. Very disappointing!

They worked fine walking in light rain for 30 minutes. But, I’m looking for more in a pair for rain pants.
review.name: Doesn’t go the distance

review.reviewBody: A pair of these pants arrived today in size large/regular, which was the size indicated for my waist on the chart accessed from the product webpage.  The fit is loose, but might have been acceptable had there been a substantial way to tighten the waist line.  Unfortunately, there is neither a  drawstring nor belt loops on these pants, and both the hook and loop patches are not only equally small ( maybe 1.5 x 2"), but placed such that there is no way of tightening the fit.  When they line up, the fit is loose (on me) and there are no options.  Usually, the loop section is longer, such that the hook section can be pulled further before pressing in place, but not so with these oddities.  Since I only had them on for 30 seconds, and it wasn't raining inside the house at the time, I can't judge whether they are good for inclement weather or not, but I can say that even a sedate walk would be too active for these pants, and they definitely run large.
review.name: no way of tightening the waist

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Seem well made, like the full zip. They are a bit snugger in the seat than I expected, but I think they’ll be okay. Will mainly be using for walking the dog in the rain
review.name: Nice rain pants

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] great looking and fitting pants got in summer will wear this winter 
I am sure the will keep me warm marmot makes a great products
review.name: love them

review.reviewBody: This is my second pair of these rain pants - wore the first pair clean out.  I find these pants to fit just right and they're easy to get on & off.  First pair was durable and worked well when hiking or cycling.
review.name: Comfortable, Durable & Easy On-Off

review.reviewBody: I've had these a while, keep them in my car for rain, whatnot. Recently used them on a wet, snowy hike up to some hot springs, and they performs just fabulously. Not too noisy, kept me perfectly dry during the long hike in falling snow, zippers are large and easy to work, buttons are good quality. I'm liking them a lot. I got M/Long, fits over boots well, waistband fits under pack belt comfortable without any real problems. Can recommend as a shell. No insulation, which makes it good for a warmer, wet hike.
review.name: I love them

name: PreCip Eco Full-Zip Pant - Men's

review.reviewBody: I love the look and feel of these gloves!  They're very comfy inside.  Also happy to be back to a Leki glove with the Trigger loop integrated in the glove.  As a long time Trigger user, I went from an integrated loop glove, to the external strap and glove combo and now back to integrated.  The Velcro on the external straps were no longer holding, after many years of instructing skiing, so they've been retired.  I highly recommend Leki gloves with the integrated loop!
review.name: Returning to an integrated Trigger loop

review.reviewBody: Gloves are true to size, and fit well.  The integrated loop fits a bit differently than what I was used to with the Leki straps, but easy to get used to. Gloves are warm, and stayed moderately dry even on a rainy day.
review.name: Great Glove

review.reviewBody: Well thought thru and warm. I like that it has overlap leather where we wipe the goggles and ribs for easy stretching. Fingers are a bit longer than other Leiki gloves I've had off the same size. Hopefully it will last.
review.name: Nice and well designed gloves

review.reviewBody: The gloves seem to fit nicely and have a nice clean look to them.
review.name: Good looking gloves

review.reviewBody: Great fit, warm enough for most days and stylish!!
review.name: I like it

review.reviewBody: Bought the gloves because I needed a pair to work with the Leki strapless poles I recently purchased. Gloves are warm and seem to be of high quality. They are very similar to my reference standard Hestra gloves. Note: the strapless system takes a little getting used to.
review.name: Fine and durable gloves

review.reviewBody: Warm, functional and great 👍 I don’t usually wear gloves while skiing. This glove is an exception.
review.name: Warm hands and fingers 😃

name: Patrol 3D Glove - Men's

review.reviewBody:
Hard to understand the Barbour lineup - the weight of this jacket is somewhere in the middle of their jackets. Ultimately I needed something warmer (the Powell). 

The fit was superb for me - much less boxy than the Powell. Sleeve length was about perfect (I need a 36"). The details were very nice, and while I like the collar strap from a styling point of view, it sort of kept sticking in my face. Maybe that will fall down a bit with use. 

A good milder winter (or West Coast winter perhaps) jacket, but I needed this for a trip to the East Coast.
review.name: Great jacket - not as warm as I needed

review.itemreviewed: Nova 3 Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Bought the gtx version back in summer for my daily wear in town shoe. Like them at first but about three months in the sole started peeling and the and the laces failed. 
Compared to my very first pair of heavy duty boot that I put many peak summits away with(mid to late 90s). These novas were not that! I'll be using other means of footwear from this experience forward. Euro is gear is at the Pinnacle for a reason . Please find quality  you had back in the day, again then maybe I'll be back. Thanks for listening 🤙
review.name: A for effort, that's about it

review.itemreviewed: Nova 3 Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I owned these for less than a month and had to return them because my feet got soaked. Not walking thru water, walking in wet grass.
review.name: Not waterproof

review.itemreviewed: Nova 3 Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Can be slippery. Fits like a slipper. So comfortable.
review.name: Comfortable

review.itemreviewed: Nova 3 Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I bought these about 3 weeks ago. They are very stable and comfortable. Just today though, the top boot lace hook popped off while tying them up :-/ so hopefully I can exchange them for another pair.
review.name: Feel Great

review.itemreviewed: Nova 3 Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Not as comfortable my last pair. I had the  Nova 3 Mid Tactical Olive color. For less than 1year and the shoe sole came apart. It was a really comfy shoes. Compare to my new ones :(
review.name: Not satisfied with the shoes

review.itemreviewed: Nova 3 Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I bought these shoes because they were supposed to be waterproof, but sadly they are not. I like the shoe a lot because they are warm and comfortable, but I really need waterproof, so I cannot recommend them to anyone looking for waterproof shoes.
comment: We'd love the opportunity to help at 800-288-3124 or live chat at Merrell.com.

review.itemreviewed: Nova 3 Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Love these shoes. I wanted a light weight boot to do nightly walks . These walks are off the roadway and in gravel and grassy hills. Great hiking boot.
review.name: Hiking 🥾

review.itemreviewed: Nova 3 Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Impressive Build and Quality! Comfortable like a tennis shoe but stable enough to be a hiker.
review.name: Light Hiker and comfortable for all day wear.

review.itemreviewed: Nova 3 Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: 10/10 would not recommend if you’re wanting waterproof. Comfortable yes. These shoes are not waterproof. My feet get wet with even the smallest amount of dew on the grass. We haven’t had rain here in over a month and my feet and socks are wet daily.

comment: We appreciate your feedback and would like to help in any way we can. Give our team a call at 800.288.3124. Thanks!

review.itemreviewed: MTB Air Layer Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: Just so breathable that you barely notice them on. Will for sure be wearing these all summer. Two rides in and love them. A little tight I the thighs, but not bad. Legs are bigger than most so imagine that’s a normal fit.
review.name: Super cool.

review.itemreviewed: MTB Air Layer Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: These seem to be great bibs. The fit is true to size and feels great. The chamois feels amazing. There is just one small problem. They are extremely revealing and see through, as in X rated. It's so bad my wife asked why I bought bike clothes for a "fun time" outfit.
review.name: Seem to be a Great Bib with a Problem
comment: how is that a problem. That is actually good because it vents well and is light. This is meant to go with shorts for MTB.

review.itemreviewed: MTB Air Layer Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: First off, I?m 6?2? and about 175 pounds. The medium fit perfectly. Supportive but not too snug and the chamois stays put. Very breathable. Functional pockets for snacks, keys, phone, etc. can?t carry a full size bottle but maybe a smaller one or a collapsible bottle would fit in the back pocket. The padding in the chamois is nice and thick, and my sit bones weren?t sore after 3+ hrs of technical single track. I think the gel really helped. The silicone on the leg opening was comfortable and held well. They ended up about mid thigh, leaving about an inch gap between the hem of the shorts and my knee pads. Very possibly my new favorites. Oh, and the belly was stretchy enough to easily use the restroom while wearing them... very important!
review.name: Excellent summer liner

review.reviewBody: These are my first pair of Altra boots & they are surprisingly comfortable, with a bit of a cushion & stable support. Normally a size 10 is a bit big on me but these fit in a more snug way. I’m excited to see how they hold up!
review.name: Love ‘em!

review.reviewBody: 1/2 size up, fit great. I've had these in perfect trail conditions, postholing in frozen slush junk, slick mud, river crossing, bushwhacking. Combine with trekking poles and you have 4x4.
review.name: Great for backpacking

review.reviewBody: Loved my first pair of Altra lone peaks. The pull tab on the back broke early on though so glad to see a new pull tab style, more sturdy. The toe box on this new model feels narrower though.
review.name: Improvements great but narrower toe box?

review.reviewBody: Altra keeps trying to reinvent the wheel every year. The Lone Peak 6 Mid was THE most comfortable durable and greatest piece of foot wear ever created right down to color options. This one is horrible
review.name: DEI failures

review.reviewBody: Own a previous pair in a size smaller & fit great but were not stiff enough for ankle support. These look good & have the support but are very tight at the top & sides of the widest part of my foot.
review.name: I love the look of these hikers

review.reviewBody: I suffer from morton's neuroma and low back pain. Decided to try zero drop shoes and a wider toe box. Altra seemed like a good option to try. I wore Red Wings previously. I wear these hikers daily for my everyday shoe. I work outdoors everyday in a farm and ranch environment. I really enjoy these shoes. Neuroma is better. Back pain is better. Altra - please consider a "work" line of footwear. I'd be first in line.
review.name: Great outdoor shoe

review.reviewBody: Great boot. After 8 to 15 long hikes the heel cushion collapsed with my way I heel strike. The grip is fantastic.
review.name: The boot is super light for the miles I hike 12 + . The zero

review.reviewBody: I can't comment on durability, but they are super comfortable. They are the right fit in my mid foot and heel, and nice and roomy in the toe box. I usually wear 11 and I had to go up to 11.5
review.name: Great out of the box

review.reviewBody: I gave it 5 stars because it's true to the description on the website. Super comfy insole, good ankle support, & though not waterproof, it kept most of the water I splashed in, out of my shoe. I would say once water gets on past the tongue, then you'll feel it. I hiked in Yosemite and Redwoods and they were a good pair to have. The extra toe space was a nice addition too. Only drawback is though it has grip on the outsole, once dust or even a smooth stone/tree branch/etc is underneath it, it does have trouble staying true. Overall a good shoe, I even planned on writing a review when I got back home. I threw the shoe through the wringer and tripped over enough rocks or slipped down a few mountains to say that it held up.
review.name: I'd hike that

review.reviewBody: I bought these boots for the added ankle protection, but they failed. I only used them one day (8 miles) and they started to fall apart. I also bought these in the same size I get in the other Lone Peak Series and they were too small. If you buy these up size by at least a half size and don't expect them to work in terrain other than groomed hiking trails (AKA pavement). I will be returning these as soon as I possible.
review.name: Dont hold up and fit small

name: Lone Peak Hiker 2 Boot - Men's

review.reviewBody: This was the only fleece jacket that I found with a fashionable design.  It runs small so I'm glad I got the medium.  It's perfection.  Easy to dress up and casual enough to wear with leggings to the hockey rink.  Warmer than any down jacket.  Backcountry was 40% less than other retailers.  Buy it!
review.name: Amazing style and warmth!

review.reviewBody: I finally had to order this jacket and lose all hope in the jacket I actually wanted. The other jacket I wanted, I had to send back THREE times. The first time they sent me a jacket with a rip in it. The second time they sent me the wrong jacket. The third time they sent me back the same jacket with the exact same tip in it. The rip was in the exact same place with the exact same rip. All customer service could say was it wasn’t their fault. Well, it wasn’t mine either. But THREE times. And their compensation offer was pitiful. Do not order from them. They send you damaged items.
review.name: Sent me back damaged item
comment: We regret the issues you experienced with your previous jacket order and understand your decision to purchase a different one. We have sent you an email to discuss this further.

review.reviewBody: Great ! Been wearing 997 for years, have many pairs ! No doubt I will buy more at some point
review.name: For years

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable shoe. Had these before and they are still as good. Good quality, build and support. Love the look too.
review.name: Great all round trainer

review.reviewBody: I’ve been a longtime fan and wearer of New Balance footwear - my football boots are NB Tekela FG - my football trainers are RC42 and my work footwear are also New Balance - I already knew when I bought these shoes they would be good
review.name: Big fan of New Balance footwear
comment: Thank you for your feedback on the 997H, and for being a loyal customer, Mick! We are delighted to hear that you love the shoes! Enjoy!

review.reviewBody: Good value trainers. Look nice. Not as comfortable or as good a fit as my usual go to 574 trainers. Bought them because they were on offer. Size 10 was huge, 9 was a little tight, so had to go for a 9 1/2 in the end. Would by again if they are on offer, otherwise I'll stick with my 574's.
review.name: Nice Trainers, but size down for a good fit
comment: Thank you for sharing your opinion with us. We are glad that you like your 997. Remember that you can contact our customer service for advice on choosing the correct size for a new model.

review.reviewBody: Looks nice but not comfy never ever will buy something online
review.name: So so not that good
comment: It's a shame to hear that your 997Hs didn't come out as comfortable as expected. We would love to help you find a comfortable alternative, feel free to click the live chat button. Your feedback is appreciated!

review.reviewBody: Trainers  for work came up narrow  good price prefer  other NB shoes won’t buy again
review.name: 97hh
comment: We appreciate your feedback, and are sorry to hear you won't buy the 997H trainers again. Finding the right width is key to comfort, and we are here to help you with that. Please reach out to us.

review.reviewBody: Couldn't have been better. I wear it with such pleasure that I don't know where to put it.
review.name: Best
comment: Thank you for your feedback on the 997H! We are delighted to hear that you love the shoes! The pleasure is ours!

review.reviewBody: The sole came loose after 1 week of wear them. Not the best experience.
review.name: Shoe Sole
comment: Thank you for sharing your feedback, and we're sorry to hear about the issue with the sole. We understand how frustrating this must be, and we strive to provide high-quality products. Please reach out to our customer service team, and we'll be happy to assist you regarding this matter.

review.reviewBody: My new go to shoe; extremely comfortable, stylish (goes with any outfit). Will also purchase in additional colourways
review.name: Amazing Shoes

review.reviewBody: Brilliant, stylish and comfy, would definitely recommend
review.name: 997H are a stylish, and comfortable fit!

review.itemreviewed: Merino 200 Dawnder Plaid Flannel Shirt - Women's
review.reviewBody: Usually love icebreaker stuff, but not this one. Arms are too small around. Fabric very stiff and a bit scratchy.  Loved the bright pink color. Ended up returning.
review.name: Strange cut in arms

review.itemreviewed: Merino 200 Dawnder Plaid Flannel Shirt - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] As others have noted this garment is a bit scratchy though washing it before wearing seems to help. Otherwise it is very comfortable, fits perfectly without being either too tight or too baggy. I also like the color very much as it goes with everything.
review.name: Very good fit

review.itemreviewed: Merino 200 Dawnder Plaid Flannel Shirt - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a great shirt for chilly fall weather. It's warm, has a structured shape, and bright cheerful color.
review.name: People keep complimenting me on this shirt

review.itemreviewed: Merino 200 Dawnder Plaid Flannel Shirt - Women's
review.reviewBody: Nice tight flat weave. I'm usually a small and the XS fit perfectly; maybe a little big. The sleeves were quite long so should fit someone with long arms. Overall the women's cut had too much room in the torso, a strange curve at the bottom, and was not for me. Also wish the colors were not quite so stereotypically feminine. If the men's came in XS or XXS that would be great.
review.name: Good Quality Fabric; Cut Not For Me

review.itemreviewed: Merino 200 Dawnder Plaid Flannel Shirt - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Even though it's summer here I've worn this shirt a few times. It's lightweight wool with a super vibrant color. So many compliments! It's comfortable with just a bit of wool scratch. My regular size fits perfectly. I also like that the back is a bit longer.
review.name: Beautiful shirt

review.itemreviewed: Merino 200 Dawnder Plaid Flannel Shirt - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I wear this over a tee shirt. It's soft and designed well. Very casual chic and appropriate for a relaxed day or evening. Lots of compliments and I feel very Confident when I am wearing it.
review.name: Beautiful plaid merino fabric!

review.itemreviewed: Merino 200 Dawnder Plaid Flannel Shirt - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought a size up since I wear the shirt Over a tee shirt. It's soft and very well designed. The colors are exactly as described. Casual chic! Great with denim or black Pants. I would buy it again. Another high quality Purchase!
review.name: I love the beautiful plaid!

name: Merino 200 Dawnder Plaid Flannel Shirt - Women's

review.reviewBody: This is a great pannier, very well built, ample space and the clips to connect to the bike are easy to use and well made. I also bought the commuter insert which basically makes this pannier perfect. Except the closure mechanism with the buckle on either side which connect to the strap are a little cumbersome to use. description: Buy the Black Diamond Beta Light Tent: 2-Person 3-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Beta Light Tent: 2-Person 3-Season
hasVariant.description: Buy the Black Diamond Beta Light Tent: 2-Person 3-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I just received and unpack the beta light and the matching ground cloth. I confirm that the tent has four mid panel tie out loops, two on each side. It also comes with 4 adjustable cords for the tie out loops stored in the stake bag. The ground cloth weights about 13oz, it has 6 stake out points with bungee cords. There are also 6 toggle connectors near the corners to connect to the bug net loops. Each connectors are about 5-6 inches inward from the edge. 

I hope these information help.
review.name: Just received my beta light tent

review.reviewBody: Tried this tent on a late summer trip in WY. Weather was nice, chill nights, some lightning storms. For a 1 person use, for 20 days, with no footprint, was roomy and lightweight, but this tent needs a lot more ventilation!: either a little window on the top part (like the megamid’s), or a zipper pull allowing to open it up from the top, or the bug protection skirt should be detachable.. or something! There just too much condensation happening in this tent!
review.name: Lightweight, roomy, but HOT!

review.reviewBody:
I’d give the BetaLight 5 stars but it needs a hair more ventilation up high. They could do this with a mesh backed flap or tube high on either end.
Other than that, this shelter is perfect IMO. Lots of room, love the mesh perimeter (could be a bit longer?), fabric is a definite improvement over the Sil material.
review.name: Almost Perfect

review.reviewBody: Exactly the bombproof, we’ll-designed shelter for long journeys that I was looking for. I don’t know why I waited so long to purchase one.
review.name: Perfect simplicity

review.reviewBody: I bought the Beta light this past spring and have just started putting it to the rest and well I LOVE IT! I had hot nights and super cold night in it and my dog and I are happy. It packs super small and for solo trips with my furry pal, it’s awesome. Super spacious! So far I have been lucky with only rain at night so haven’t set up on a wet ground yet but I have thought about getting a ground cloth for it, but it’s literally no where to be found on this website. Can we even get a ground cloth for this shelter?
review.name: Love it…but where to buy the ground cloth?

review.reviewBody:
I have now used this shelter for 15 nights. Love the ease of setup, the weight, the price, and the weather resistance. 

Only problem is that I live in a buggy part of the world and was hoping the bug protection would be sufficient. Sadly, it was not. Worked well for mosquitoes and other flying bugs, just not for spiders. We had two straight nights of waking up to daddy long legs crawling on our faces. Not great for sleeping.

Come up with a better connection between the bug net and the ground sheet and I would happily buy this again!
review.name: Almost there!

review.reviewBody:
I have had the original beta mid for years and have used it for backpacking and ski touring. For ski touring just set up the tent and dig down into the snow and provide room to stand and create a bench to sleep on. 
Because it’s light and small we have taken it on our adventure trips to Australia and Europe. My wife made sure we had the beta bug screen for the Australia trip. I highly recommend this tent.
review.name: Great multipurpose tent

review.reviewBody: Had the chance to put the Beta light to the test on a backpacking trip into the John Muir Wilderness. Super light. Easy to setup. Plenty of space for two adults w/ gear. GREAT lightweight tent.
review.name: BD crushes it again

review.reviewBody:
As far as tarp shelters on the market, the Beta Light is hard to beat for the price. We had the older silnylon version as well (which was lighter but lacked the bug mesh skirt and guy out points), but unfortunately there was a fabric fault in the nylon and ours was not at all waterproof. Like, rain easily penetrated the main panel of the fabric kind of not waterproof. 

Anyway, after waiting for about a year and a half for the new Beta Light to finally become available, we now have the new version. We've put it through the initial paces on some Cascade volcanoes, and overall we're happy with the new version. It's properly waterproof (having kept us dry through all-night rain and snow mix on Mt Adams), and the bug mesh is a nice addition. Also, ours has guy-out points! This was an obvious miss in the previous version, and guying out the panels makes a big livability difference on the inside. Honestly, it's a very windworthy design to begin with, so I'm not sure how much difference the guy outs make for stability, but it sure is roomier inside. 

Unfortunately, that's where the improvements end. Why on God's green earth Black Diamond refuses to add so much as a second zipper pull to the main zipper, nevermind peak vents, is totally beyond me. We all know how tarp shelters accumulate condensation on the inside, and this tarp has ZERO venting options. You can always set it higher off the ground, but then you give up the bug mesh protection and allow wind gusts into the tent. Peak vents would be ideal, but even the ability to crack open the top of the zipper would go a long way. 

All in all, it's a great shelter for the price. Lightweight, downright palatial on the inside, and VERY windworthy by design. But the fact that BD keeps missing what their customers have been asking for is a bit disappointing. Also, it's cool to say in the video that a ground tarp exists, but I have been waiting for more than two years now to buy it and haven't been able to find it anywhere.
review.name: Awesome overall. Missing some obvious features that would have made it 5 star.

review.reviewBody: As in other reviews, the single wall tent allows moisture to condense on the walls when temperatures drop below freezing. If the tent is shook it can have the effect of raining inside. In warmer temperatures this was not an issue.
review.name: Not the best for fluctuating temperature

name: Beta Light Tent: 2-Person 3-Season

review.reviewBody: Love the product. Purchased 2 outfits last year and 1 this year, so far. Plan is to purchase another this year. Great for travel. Soft and warm, as well as great for the fall and winter weather.
review.name: Will Purchase Again

review.reviewBody: Super happy I got this pants for when I am doing errands on rainy and cold days. The pants run somewhat short. If you are a tall dude, this pants might not be for you.
review.name: Short, but great purchase.

review.reviewBody: the regular length legs are really short for a tall person....too short the material is great though
review.name: no

review.reviewBody: Loved these during my travels to Hokkaido, kept me decently warm (I usually run warm) and are super comfortable. Definitely no need for heavy jeans when travelling with these as an alternative
review.name: Most comfortable pants yet

review.reviewBody: I use the tech pants for travel. They are very comfortable for sitting for long periods of time. And very flexible
review.name: Love love love these pants

review.reviewBody: I use this pants for casual every day. I like it because it's light and very comfortable not at all for winter, but summer is perfect for for this pant I just bought my second pant, This is how good these are, get one and you won't regret
review.name: Yes, I will definitely buy this product again. Yes,

review.reviewBody: I love the material here, but one huge bummer is the waiste. For one, it's way too big. I ordered a medium and it's several inches too big. What's worse is the way the waiste band and drawstring work: the waiste gets bunched up where you tie the drawstring. The drawstring itself is very thin so it gets pulled super-tight where you made your knot. This makes it very difficult to untie. I previously ordered a small, and while it fit perfect in the waiste, the legs were fairly high-water. It also fit a little too snug around my privates, displaying my junk to the world. I could tell they'd shrink in the wash so I went with the medium. I want to love these so bad, but the fit is just way off. Taking them to a tailor.
review.name: Waiste is way too big

review.reviewBody: The best time for this paint right now it's like breedable well design. It's very good for every day and I definitely will buy these pants again.
review.name: Oh yes, I definitely will buy this product again

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I liked the product but it was too large. If I could exchange online I would have just swapped for a smaller size.
review.name: Too large, otherwise very nice!

review.reviewBody:
The hat is warmer than a double layer merino wool beanie I previously wore. The internal head band adds protection and the wool is thick.

I'm a pretty normally sized tall man. 6ft2inches , 215 pounds, average IQ, and it's pretty tight on my skull. My glasses were compressed tightly for the first month of use, but it's slightly stretching.

I'm glad I bought it. 

I've worn it down to about 10f (excluding wind chill). I bet it'll be good down to -10f or lower.
review.name: Warm, small but stretches

review.reviewBody: love the lambs wool for its super warmth and so comfy. you would think wool might be itchy but this lambs wool is quite the opposite! use it daily on my winter walks with the dog!
review.name: Best beanie for the winter!

review.reviewBody: This is our all time favorite wool hat. It is amazingly warm for the thickness (thank you, boiled lambs wool!) and the fleece band inside keeps it from feeling scratchy on your ears. It fits my big 7 3/4 noggin and my wife's 7 1/2 and our daughters 7 1/4 just as well. Really, it's a fabulous hat!
review.name: Family fights for this hat

review.reviewBody: Super warm hat!  Runs small (one size).
review.name: Super warm!  Runs small.

review.reviewBody: Fits snugly and comes down fully over the ears! Very warm and also stylish.Fantastic hat for the cold. I live in the Yukon, and this one deserves the monicker "Yukon"!
review.name: Fantastic hat for the cold.

review.reviewBody: This boiled wool beanie is soft on the inside and tightly knit which provides the warmth I require on cold winter adventures. If I could change anything about this product I would love to add a little bill. Outside of that it's perfect.
review.name: Love it!

review.reviewBody: This toque is great. It is very warm but also very lightweight. I have a small head, and the band around the ears fits perfectly. I think it would be a little tight on someone with a more normal-adult-sized head. The toque is very warm and handled a cold SK winter with ease, with temps -30C (-22F) or worse. Stood up to wind fine as well. Overall, very happy with this buy.
review.name: Great toque

review.reviewBody: I am a big fan of this hat. It looks good and feels warm. The quality of the hat feels like it is well built and will last a long time. Sizing: I would say my head is generally small. I wear s/m bike helmets; moto helmets and my hat size is 7 and 3/8s, so S/M hats will work when I'm not going for a size-specific hat. This hat is labled as "1 size" and is snug. I'm hoping for a bit of stretch as it wears in. I will never be able to wash this hat as per directions. If I had a "large" head, this hat would work. I'm keeping my fingers crossed that it will stretch a bit.
review.name: Nice hat. Looks great. Small heads perfect.

review.reviewBody: Very warm and comfortable! The boiled wool is soft and the inner fleece brim prevents the possibility of any itchiness (for those without hair like me).
review.name: Great Toque!

review.reviewBody: fleece lined, super warm in windy conditions, larger hat that fully covers ears. I bought this for my dad and brother and they both love it (both have 'larger' heads. super stylish too
review.name: stylish - would purchase again as a great gift!

name: Whiskey Peak Beanie - Men's

review.reviewBody: I absolutely love these camping chairs! I love them so much, I've bought them for all of my family over the last few years. They are the most comfortable camping chairs you can get, they have a little bit more of a relaxed feel with the backrest being a little more laid back then most standard camping chairs, which usually make me feel like I'm sitting at a 90 degree angle. (Which is not what i want when trying to relax at camp) Also the lowdown aspect of them make them feel like a lazy boy and make it so i can sit closer to the camp fire! The carrying case is also a very genius design, instead of having to very particularly slid the chair into a hole that doesn't seem like it was designed to ever be put back in. This carrying case wraps the chair up like a burrito making it so much easier to pack up in a hurry. I will continue to only use this specific camping chair for my adventures because of these reasons, and I think you should too!
review.name: Best Camping Chair Ever!!

review.reviewBody: The chair is small, light, and sturdy. It's perfect for weekend camping trips or days in the park. There's enough give in the seat to offer plenty of comfort, and the supportive backrest allows me to sit comfortably for hours. The side pocket holds my phone and a cold beverage, and it all packs up quickly and neatly when breaking down camp.
review.name: Perfect low-profile chair!

name: Lowdown Chair
